channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Kraft Heinz to remove artificial dyes from all products, like Jell-O and Kool-Aid
item.description: By 2027, Kraft Heinz says all artificial food dyes will be replaced with natural colors. The move comes two months after federal officials called on f...

item.title: Leader of top FEMA disaster coordination office resigns, as Trump moves to eliminate agency
item.description: Jeremy Greenberg was in charge of coordinating federal help after hurricanes, wildfires, earthquakes and other emergencies. He has resigned from leadi...

item.title: Book Review: ‘Not My Type,’ by E. Jean Carroll
item.description: Her lawyers urged that she keep her testimony short. With legal victories in hand, she’s sharing her life story, and what it was like on the stand.

item.title: Brad Lander Is Arrested by ICE Agents at Immigration Courthouse
item.description: Mr. Lander, the New York City comptroller and a candidate for mayor, was handcuffed as he tried to steer a man past Immigration and Customs Enforcemen...

item.title: Alfred Brendel, Bravura Pianist Who Forged a Singular Path, Dies at 94
item.description: With little formal training but full of ideas, he focused on the core classical composers, winning over audiences (though not every critic) worldwide.

item.title: Trump threatens Iran's supreme leader, escalating his rhetoric about the conflict
item.description: President Trump called Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei an "easy target" but said, "We are not going to take him out (kill!), at least not...

item.title: How Trump's travel ban could disrupt the way knowledge about health is shared
item.description: Global health specialists talk about the consequences of the full or partial ban on travel to the U.S. from 19 countries.

item.title: Was Basketball Invented in Herkimer, NY? The Human Calculator Thinks So.
item.description: The official story is that Dr. James Naismith invented basketball in Springfield, Mass., in 1891. But what about the teenager tossing cabbages in upst...

item.title: With the World Cup a year away, the U.S. men's soccer team needs a shot in the arm
item.description: A handful of dreadful losses — plus some drama between the team's biggest star and its new head coach — has the USMNT looking for a badly-needed rebou...

item.title: Bernie Sanders Endorses Zohran Mamdani for N.Y.C. Mayor
item.description: Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont backed Mr. Mamdani, joining Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez in endorsing the front-runner of progressives.

item.title: Dozens of Palestinians Are Killed While Trying To Get Aid
item.description: The Gaza Health Ministry said at least 50 people were killed, blaming Israeli forces. The Israeli military said it was aware of reports of people inju...

item.title: U.S. Revokes Visa of Former Panamanian President Who Criticized Trump Deal
item.description: Two politicians who spoke out against recent accords between the United States and Panama lost their permission to travel to the United States.

item.title: As Israel attacks, Iranians flee capital in search of safety.
Live Updates: Trump Calls for ‘Unconditional Surrender’ From Iran
item.description: Evidence continued to grow that the United States was considering joining Israel’s bombing campaign. President Trump threatened Iran’s supreme leader ...

item.title: Is Abortion Legal in the UK? What to Know About the Law and Proposed Changes
item.description: British lawmakers will debate possible legislation to prevent women from being criminally prosecuted for ending their pregnancies.
